reviews.review: Coming from a tf2 player this game is great. The servers are fun and the community is normally welcoming depending on the person. I met some great tfc veterans in this game. Despite the game being dated it's still fun to play.
For one of my first online multi-player game, this is pretty good. Not much else to say.

This is mainly for my friends, while I know most of you focus on TF2, I recommend giving classic a try it's pretty fun once you get the hang of it. While the class grenades can be questionable at times I like to compare them to critical hits, all of the classes play relatively the same aside from maybe pyro and scout but yeah other then that this is a pretty great game. 

(If you're concerned about the price of the game though just get it during a sale it usually goes for around a dollar lol)

It's a pretty good game with a small but active player base which is mostly made up of long-time players of the game. 

If you are a Team Fortress 2 player, you will find the way the game plays and its mechanics to feel weird and clunky at first as the classes in the game and the weapons they use are much different from the ones in Team Fortress 2 as well as having 2 different grenades that can be used for each class.

If you were going to buy it, I'd say to wait for it to go on sale unless you have fond memories of this game and intend to play it a lot.

And on the topic of this great little game, my Steam ID is actually Team_Fortress_Classic. It's so classic that you can even play it on an ancient dial-up connection.
Its very fun if you like old games

[h1]Team Fortress Classic: Outclassed by Time[/h1]
[b]Introduction to Team Fortress Classic[/b]
Team Fortress Classic is an online Team-based action game that takes some assets from Half-Life and expands upon it with its unique gameplay, 9 classes, and Red/Blue Teams.
Unfortunately, this game has not aged well, and it especially shows nowadays. The difference between this game and its sequel Team Fortress 2 are night and day. Classes in this game look and play differently from their TF2 counterparts, and not for the better (No medigun for Medic, Scout has no double jump, and Sniper has to charge shots, just to name a few). There are still servers up to this day, but only a few have actual people in them. The rest of the servers are completely empty. The players still playing TFC are ridiculously good at the game, and it's difficult to survive for long in the explosive chaos.

[b]Rating: A Classic Outclassed by its Sequel[/b]
I'd give this game a 3/10. I honestly had a little fun with this game, but with hardcore TFC players aloof, that fun didn't last for long. This game isn't worth buying individually, even for $5. Only get it if its in a Half-Life or Valve bundle (Which is how I got this game). Though I'd recommend just downloading Team Fortress 2 (It's Free) and playing that game for a better Team Fortress experience as it improves upon everything that this game created.

Far superior than the uninspired, hacker-rampant TF2
Substantially friendlier community if you hang out with the big-name OST guys, but you get the same level of unsustainable long-term autism any boomer shooter brings. People will always scream at you if "you" make any sort of mistake, for instance if your blind sniper runs into you while you're diseased and far away from your team, or if you don't know your way around some obscure map nobody's played since 2001, be prepared for some assassin's creed sperg or goldi-locks to spittle their baby food all over their keyboard.
Grenade spam is annoying, but about as common as sticky spam so it's a fair trade.

People should be more like the OST guys and attempt to educate politely, not scream at any new player that makes the simplest mistake. Gatekeeping your horribly balanced boomer shooter doesn't do anyone any good.

[b]TFC has a very high skill floor, but none of that is in relation to in-game mechanics. Being able to handle nailguns and high-speed combat are the barrier to entry, and just like Quake or UT, most people are going to quit because of that. The game isn't particularly hard and it isn't particularly balanced either. Scout and Pyro are quite literally worthless because Scout is outclassed and Pyro only performs well comparatively if you're using dialup. It's not a game that was refined and designed around every class being useful like TF2, so you should have some vague idea as to what each class' strengths and crushing weaknesses are before you hop in. That being said, with the very few available options you're mostly going to be in shotgun fights so the only transferable skill from TF2 is being a scout main and knowing how to meatshot people. Air nades have incredible delay and are pretty sluggish, so piping is spam-and-pray more than ever, and grenade spam is the equivalent of stickybomb spam, so it's goddamn annoying but you get used to dying 100% out of your control a hell of a lot.[/b]

Just don't let the autistic people ruin a potentially fun experience.

Es muy caotico y en la mayoria de las partidas no tendras idea de lo que lo que esta pasando. 
El juego esta muy mal balanceado, unas clases son buenisimas mientras que otras son basura. Todas las clases tienen como 5 o mas granadas que son superpoderosas, cuando las espamean en defensa es muy dificil de salir del spawn. 

Visualmente es un desastre, yo se que este juego es un producto de su tiempo pero eso no le quita lo visualmente feo que se ve (pienso que hasta el doom y el quake se ven mejor). Todo tiene colores grises y opacos, las explosiones y las particulas de fuego bloquean tu vista completamente.  

No lo recomiendo para nada, a menos que estes interesado en como ha evolucionado la saga de team fortress. Ademas el juego es muy barato así que no me quejo mucho en cuanto a eso. 
4/10

It was ok when it came out, but is aged horribly. Team Fortress Classic has become obsolete by the release of Team Fortress 2. There is nothing about the original game that hasn’t been done 10 times better by its successor. For a Valve multiplayer classic that has aged better than this, check out Day of Defeat or Half-Life Multiplayer.
